text: Philip B. Heymann (October 30, 1932 - November 30, 2021) was an American lawyer, federal prosecutor, legal scholar and law professor. He was in charge of the Criminal Division of the Justice Department as Assistant Attorney General during the Carter administration and was briefly Deputy Attorney General in the Clinton administration. Heymann died on November 30, 2021 in Los Angeles, California from problems caused by a stroke, one month after his 89th birthday. ==References== Category:1932 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Lawyers from Pittsburgh Category:Politicians from Pittsburgh Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:United States Deputy Attorneys General Category:Deaths from stroke
title: Philip Heymann
